protocol_name: Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103
protocol_name_html: Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103
description: The NEBNext Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina contains the enzymes and buffers required to convert a broad range of input amounts of DNA into high quality libraries for next-generation sequencing on the Illumina platform. The fast, user-friendly workflow also has minimal hands-on time.
before_start: Starting Material: 500 pg–1 μg fragmented DNA. We recommend that DNA be sheared in 1X TE. If the DNA volume post shearing is less than 50 μl, add 1X TE to a final volume of 50 μl. Alternatively, samples can be diluted with 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0 or 0.1X TE.

materials.reagent_name: NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer
NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix
NEBNext Singleplex or Multiplex Oligos for Illumina
Only for E7645: SPRIselect Reagent Kit or AMPure XP Beads

components.data: NEBNext End Prep
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add the following components to a sterile nuclease-free tube:

 

Component Volume
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix  3 µl
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer 7 µl
Fragmented DNA 50 µl
Total volume 60 µl
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add the following components to a sterile nuclease-free tube:

 

Component Volume
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix  3 µl
NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer 7 µl
Fragmented DNA 50 µl
Total volume 60 µl

components.data: NEBNext End Prep
components.name: Section

components.data: Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 50 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.
components.name: Description

components.data: NEBNext End Prep
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place in a thermocycler, with the heated lid set to ≥ 75°C, and run the following program:

 

30 minutes @ 20°C

30 minutes @ 65°C

Hold at 4°C

components.data: Adaptor Ligation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Determine whether adaptor dilution is necessary.

 

If DNA input is ≤ 100 ng, dilute the NEBNext Adaptor for Illumina in Tris/NaCl, pH 8.0 as indicated in Table 2.1.

 

Table 2.1: Adaptor Dilution

Input

Adaptor Dilution

(Volume of Adaptor: Total Volume)

Working Adaptor

Concentration
1 µg–101 ng No Dilution 15 µM
100 ng–5 ng 10-Fold (1:10) 1.5 µM
less than 5 ng 25-Fold (1:25) 0.6 µM
components.name: Description

source_data.annotation: The appropriate adaptor dilution for your sample input and type may need to be optimized experimentally. The dilutions provided here are a general starting point. Excess adaptor should be removed prior to PCR enrichment.

components.data: Adaptor Ligation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add the following components directly to the End Prep Reaction Mixture:

Component Amount
End Prep Reaction Mixture (Step 3) 60 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix * 30 µl
NEBNext Ligation Enhancer 1 µl
NEBNext Adaptor for Illumina ** 2.5 µl
Total Volume 93.5 µl

 

* Mix the Ultra II Ligation Master Mix by pipetting up and down several times prior to adding to the reaction.

 

** The NEBNext adaptor is provided in NEBNext Singleplex or Multiplex Oligos for Illumina.
components.name: Description

Total Volume 93.5 µl

** The NEBNext adaptor is provided in NEBNext Singleplex or Multiplex Oligos for Illumina.

source_data.annotation: The Ligation Master Mix and Ligation Enhancer can be mixed ahead of time and is stable for at least 8 hours @ 4°C. We do not recommend adding adaptor to a premix in the Adaptor Ligation Step.
source_data.thread_text: The Ligation Master Mix and Ligation Enhancer can be mixed ahead of time and is stable for at least 8 hours @ 4°C. We do not recommend adding adaptor to a premix in the Adaptor Ligation Step.
source_data.body: The Ligation Master Mix and Ligation Enhancer can be mixed ahead of time and is stable for at least 8 hours @ 4°C. We do not recommend adding adaptor to a premix in the Adaptor Ligation Step.

components.data: Adaptor Ligation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Set a 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 80 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

 

Caution: The NEBNext Ultra II Ligation Master Mix is very viscous. Care should be taken to ensure adequate mixing of the ligation reaction, as incomplete mixing will result in reduced ligation efficiency. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

components.data: Attention: Choose Size Selection or Cleanup
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Attention: Choose Size Selection or Cleanup

components.data:
Please select whether your starting material is:

  • GREATER than 50 ng to follow the protocol for size selection
  • LESS than or EQUAL to 50 ng to follow the protocol for cleanup without size selection.

 

For input LESS THAN or EQUAL to 50 ng, size selection is NOT recommended to maintain library complexity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Please select whether your starting material is:

  • GREATER than 50 ng to follow the protocol for size selection
  • LESS than or EQUAL to 50 ng to follow the protocol for cleanup without size selection.

 

For input LESS THAN or EQUAL to 50 ng, size selection is NOT recommended to maintain library complexity.

cases.title: Input ≤ 50 ng
cases.label: Cleanup of Adaptor-ligated DNA without Size Selection

components.data:
The following section is for cleanup of the ligation reaction. The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use. These bead volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second cleanup at this step. For cleanups of samples contained in different buffer conditions, the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

 

The following size selection protocol is for libraries with 200 bp inserts only. For libraries with different size fragment inserts, refer to the table below for the appropriate volumes of beads to be added. The size selection protocol is based on starting volume of 96.5 μl.

 

To select a different insert size than 200 bp, please use the volumes in this table:

 

Table 3.1: Recommended conditions for bead based size selection.
components.name: Description

The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use. These bead volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second cleanup at this step. For cleanups of samples contained in different buffer conditions, the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

 

The following size selection protocol is for libraries with 200 bp inserts only. For libraries with different size fragment inserts, refer to the table below for the appropriate volumes of beads to be added. The size selection protocol is based on starting volume of 96.5 μl.

 

To select a different insert size than 200 bp, please use the volumes in this table:

 

Table 3.1: Recommended conditions for bead based size selection.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Vortex SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 40 μl (~0.4X) of resuspended beads to the 96.5 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 40 μl (~0.4X) of resuspended beads to the 96.5 μl ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube. Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments.

 

Caution: Do not discard the supernatant.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully transfer the supernatant containing your DNA to a new tube. Discard the beads that contain the unwanted large fragments.

 

Caution: Do not discard the supernatant.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 20 μl (0.2X) resuspended SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid from the tip during the last mix. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 20 μl (0.2X) resuspended SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to the supernatant and mix at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid from the tip during the last mix. Then incubate samples on the bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant that contains unwanted DNA. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets.

 

Caution: Do not discard beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant that contains unwanted DNA. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the desired DNA targets.

 

Caution: Do not discard beads.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 μl of 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat Step 20 once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat Step 20 once. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.

 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.

 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 17 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl or 0.1X TE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads into 17 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl or 0.1X TE.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well on a vortex mixer or by pipetting up and down 10 times. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.

components.data: Size Selection of Adaptor-ligated DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on a magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 15 μl to a new PCR tube for amplification. Proceed to PCR Amplification in Step 26.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on a magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 15 μl to a new PCR tube for amplification. Proceed to PCR Amplification in Step 26.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103

components.data:
Use Option A for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in tubes. These kits have the forward and reverse primers supplied in separate tubes.

 

Use Option B for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in a 96-well plate format. These kits have the forward and reverse (i7 and i5) primers combined.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Use Option A for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in tubes. These kits have the forward and reverse primers supplied in separate tubes.

 

Use Option B for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in a 96-well plate format. These kits have the forward and reverse (i7 and i5) primers combined.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add the following components to a sterile strip tube:

 

Option A: Forward and Reverse Primer NOT Already Combined

Component Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix 25 µl
Index Primer/i7 Primer*,** 5 µl
Universal PCR Primer/i5 Primer*,**  5 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

Option B: Forward and Reverse Primer Already Combined

Comonent Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 aster Mix 25 µl
Index/Universal Primer* 10 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

* NEBNext Oligos must be purchased separately from the library prep kit. Refer to the corresponding NEBNext Oligo kit manual for determining valid barcode combinations.

** Use only one i7 primer/index primer per sample. Use only one i5 primer (or the universal primer for single index kits) per sample.
components.name: Description

Total Volume 50 µl

 

* NEBNext Oligos must be purchased separately from the library prep kit. Refer to the corresponding NEBNext Oligo kit manual for determining valid barcode combinations.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Set 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 40 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 40 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place the tube on a thermocycler and perform PCR amplification using the following PCR cycling conditions.

Cycle Step Temp Time Cycles
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 seconds 1
Denaturation 98°C 10 seconds 3-15 *
Annealing/Extension 65°C 75 seconds
Final Extension 65°C 5 minutes 1
Hold 4°C ∞  

* The number of PCR cycles should be chosen based on input amount and sample type. Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on Bioanalyzer). The number of PCR cycles recommended in Table 4.1 are to be seen as a starting point to determine the number of PCR cycles best for standard library prep samples. Use Table 4.2 for applications requiring high library yields (~1 μg) such as target enrichment.

 

Table 4.1.

INPUT DNA IN 

THE END PREP

REACTION

# OF CYCLES REQUIRED

FOR STANDART LIBRARY

PREP ~100 ng (30–100 nM)
1 µg * 3**
500 ng * 3**
100 ng * 3
50 ng 3–4
10 ng 6–7
5 ng 7–8
1 ng 9–10
0.5 ng 10–11

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done 

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.

 

Table 4.2.

INPUT DNA IN 

THE END PREP

REACTION

# OF CYCLES REQUIRED

FOR STANDART LIBRARY

PREP ~100 ng (30–100 nM)
1 µg * 3–4*,**
500 ng * 4–5**
100 ng * 6–7
50 ng 7–8
10 ng 9–10
5 ng 10–11
1 ng 12–13
0.5 ng 14–15

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.
components.name: Description

INPUT DNA IN 

THE END PREP

REACTION

# OF CYCLES REQUIRED

FOR STANDART LIBRARY

PREP ~100 ng (30–100 nM)
1 µg * 3–4*,**
500 ng * 4–5**

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Vortex SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 45 μl (0.9X) resuspended beads to the PCR reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 45 μl (0.9X) resuspended beads to the PCR reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Proceed to Cleanup of PCR Amplification in next Section: Cleanup of PCR Reaction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Proceed to Cleanup of PCR Amplification in next Section: Cleanup of PCR Reaction.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate samples on bench top for at least 5 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the DNA targets.

 

Caution: Do not discard the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain the DNA targets.

 

Caution: Do not discard the beads.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 200 μl or 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 200 μl or 80% freshly prepared ethanol to the tube/plate while in the magnetic stand. Incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds, and then carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat Step 37 once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat Step 37 once for a total of two washes. Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of ethanol with a p10 pipette tip.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.

 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Air dry the beads for up to 5 minutes while the tube/plate is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.

 

Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding 33 μl of 0.1X TE.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tube/plate from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding 33 μl of 0.1X TE.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times, or on a vortex mixer. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix well by pipetting up and down 10 times, or on a vortex mixer. Incubate for at least 2 minutes at room temperature. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tube/plate on the magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 30 μl to a new PCR tube and store at –20°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tube/plate on the magnetic stand. After 5 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer 30 μl to a new PCR tube and store at –20°C.

components.data: Cleanup of PCR Reaction
components.name: Section

components.data: Check the size distribution on an Aglient Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA chip. The sample may need to be diluted before loading. See Figure 5.1 in next step for examples.
components.name: Description

components.data: Cleanup of Adaptor-ligated DNA without Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cleanup of Adaptor-ligated DNA without Size Selection

components.data:
The following section is for cleanup of the ligation reaction. If your input DNA is > 50 ng, follow the size selection protocol by selecting > 50 ng in previous step.

 

The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use. These bead volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second cleanup at this step. For cleanups of samples contained in different buffer conditions, the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The following section is for cleanup of the ligation reaction. If your input DNA is > 50 ng, follow the size selection protocol by selecting > 50 ng in previous step.

 

The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to room temperature for at least 30 minutes before use. These bead volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow, or if this is a second cleanup at this step. For cleanups of samples contained in different buffer conditions, the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

components.data: Cleanup of Adaptor-ligated DNA without Size Selection
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Cleanup of Adaptor-ligated DNA without Size Selection

components.data: Add 87 μl (0.9X) resuspended beads to the Adaptor Ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 87 μl (0.9X) resuspended beads to the Adaptor Ligation reaction. Mix well by pipetting up and down at least 10 times. Be careful to expel all of the liquid out of the tip during the last mix. Vortexing for 3–5 seconds on high can also be used. If centrifuging samples after mixing, be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 37 of Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina E7645/E7103

components.data:
Use Option A for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in tubes. These kits have the forward and reverse primers supplied in separate tubes.

 

Use Option B for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in a 96-well plate format. These kits have the forward and reverse (i7 and i5) primers combined.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Use Option A for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in tubes. These kits have the forward and reverse primers supplied in separate tubes.

 

Use Option B for any kit where NEBNext index primers are supplied in a 96-well plate format. These kits have the forward and reverse (i7 and i5) primers combined.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Add the following components to a steribe strip tube:

 

Option A: Forward and Reverse Primer NOT Already Combined

Component Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix 25 µl
Index Primer/i7 Primer *,** 5 µl
Universal PCR Primer/i5 Primer *,**  5 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

Option B: Forward and Reverse Primer Already Combined

Component Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 aster Mix 25 µl
Index/Universal Primer * 10 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

* NEBNext Oligos must be purchased separately from the library prep kit. Refer to the corresponding NEBNext Oligo kit manual for determining valid barcode combinations.

** Use only one i7 primer/index primer per sample. Use only one i5 primer (or the universal primer for single index kits) per sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add the following components to a steribe strip tube:

 

Option A: Forward and Reverse Primer NOT Already Combined

Component Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 Master Mix 25 µl
Index Primer/i7 Primer *,** 5 µl
Universal PCR Primer/i5 Primer *,**  5 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

Option B: Forward and Reverse Primer Already Combined

Component Volume per Reaction
Adaptor Ligated DNA Fragments 15 µl
NEBNext Ultra II Q5 aster Mix 25 µl
Index/Universal Primer * 10 µl
Total Volume 50 µl

 

* NEBNext Oligos must be purchased separately from the library prep kit. Refer to the corresponding NEBNext Oligo kit manual for determining valid barcode combinations.

** Use only one i7 primer/index primer per sample. Use only one i5 primer (or the universal primer for single index kits) per sample.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: Set 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 40 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Set 100 μl or 200 μl pipette to 40 μl and then pipette the entire volume up and down at least 10 times to mix thoroughly. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data: PCR Amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
Place the tube on a thermocycler and perform PCR amplification using the following PCR cycling conditions.

Cycle Step Temp Time Cycles
Initial Denaturation 98°C 30 seconds 1
Denaturation 98°C 10 seconds 3-15 *
Annealing/Extension 65°C 75 seconds 3-15 *
Final Extension 65°C 5 minutes 1
Hold 4°C ∞  

* The number of PCR cycles should be chosen based on input amount and sample type. Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on Bioanalyzer). The number of PCR cycles recommended in Table 4.1 are to be seen as a starting point to determine the number of PCR cycles best for standard library prep samples. Use Table 4.2 for applications requiring high library yields (~1 μg) such as target enrichment.

 

Table 4.1.

INPUT DNA IN THE END PREP REACTION # OF CYCLES REQUIRED FOR STANDARD LIBRARY PREP ~100 ng (30–100 nM)
1 µg* 3**
500 ng* 3**
100 ng* 3
50 ng 3–4
10 ng 6–7
5 ng 7–8
1 ng 9–10
0.5 ng 10–11

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done 

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.

 

Table 4.2.

INPUT DNA IN THE END PREP REACTION # OF CYCLES REQUIRED FOR TARGET ENRICHMENT LIBRARY PREP (~1 µg)
1 µg* 3–4*, **
500 ng* 4–5*
100 ng* 6–7*
50 ng 7–8
10 ng 9–10
5 ng 10–11
1 ng 12–13
0.5 ng 14–15

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.
components.name: Description

Final Extension 65°C 5 minutes 1

Thus, samples prepared with a different method prior to library prep may require re-optimization of the number of PCR cycles. The number of cycles should be high enough to provide sufficient library fragments for a successful sequencing run, but low enough to avoid PCR artifacts and over-cycling (high molecular weight fragments on Bioanalyzer). The number of PCR cycles recommended in Table 4.1 are to be seen as a starting point to determine the number of PCR cycles best for standard library prep samples. Use Table 4.2 for applications requiring high library yields (~1 μg) such as target enrichment.

 

Table 4.1.

INPUT DNA IN THE END PREP REACTION # OF CYCLES REQUIRED FOR STANDARD LIBRARY PREP ~100 ng (30–100 nM)
1 µg* 3**
500 ng* 3**
100 ng* 3
50 ng 3–4
10 ng 6–7
5 ng 7–8
1 ng 9–10
0.5 ng 10–11

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done 

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.

 

Table 4.2.

INPUT DNA IN THE END PREP REACTION # OF CYCLES REQUIRED FOR TARGET ENRICHMENT LIBRARY PREP (~1 µg)
1 µg* 3–4*, **
500 ng* 4–5*
100 ng* 6–7*
50 ng 7–8
10 ng 9–10
5 ng 10–11
1 ng 12–13
0.5 ng 14–15

* These input ranges will work best when size selection is done

** NEBNext adaptors contain a unique truncated design. Libraries constructed with NEBNext adaptors require a minimum of 3 amplification cycles to add the complete adaptor sequences for downstream processes.
